programming.label: Programming / Coding

beginnerResources.title: Automate the Boring Stuff with Python

intermediateResources.title: The Odin Project – Full Stack Path

exercises: Write a script that reads a CSV file and calculates summary statistics
Build a simple CLI tool that interacts with a public API
Create a personal portfolio website with HTML/CSS/JS
Implement a to-do list app with local storage

projectIdeas.title: Personal Budget Tracker
projectIdeas.description: Build a web app that tracks income and expenses with charts

projectIdeas.title: API-Powered Dashboard
projectIdeas.description: Create a dashboard that pulls data from a public API and displays it with visualizations

weeklyMilestones: Write and run your first program
Build a small project from scratch

data-analysis.label: Data Analysis
exercises: Clean and analyze a messy real-world dataset (e.g., Kaggle's Titanic dataset)
Create pivot tables and charts from sales data in a spreadsheet
Write SQL queries to answer business questions from a sample database
Build a data pipeline that automates a daily report

projectIdeas.title: COVID-19 Data Explorer
projectIdeas.description: Build an interactive dashboard analyzing publicly available COVID-19 data by region and time

projectIdeas.title: Survey Analysis Report
projectIdeas.description: Design a survey, collect responses, clean the data, and produce an insight report with charts

machine-learning.label: Machine Learning / AI
exercises: Train a linear regression model on a housing price dataset
Build a classification model to predict customer churn
Implement k-means clustering on a customer segmentation dataset
Fine-tune a pre-trained image classifier on a custom dataset

projectIdeas.title: Sentiment Analysis Tool
projectIdeas.description: Build a model that classifies social media posts as positive, negative, or neutral

projectIdeas.title: Recommendation Engine
projectIdeas.description: Create a movie/book recommendation system using collaborative filtering

weeklyMilestones: Train your first model and evaluate it
Handle feature engineering and data preprocessing
Deploy a model as a simple API

statistics.label: Statistics
exercises: Calculate confidence intervals for a sample dataset
Run a hypothesis test (t-test) on two groups
Create a correlation matrix and interpret the results
Perform a regression analysis and explain R-squared

projectIdeas.title: A/B Test Simulator
projectIdeas.description: Build a tool that simulates A/B tests with different sample sizes and effect sizes

weeklyMilestones: Apply regression analysis to real data

research.label: Research

beginnerResources.title: How to Read a Scientific Paper

exercises: Write a literature review on a topic that interests you
Design a survey with 10 questions and test it with 5 people
Analyze an existing study's methodology and identify limitations
Synthesize findings from 3 papers into a one-page summary

projectIdeas.title: Mini Research Report
projectIdeas.description: Choose a question, design a study, collect data from 20+ people, and write up findings

communication.label: Communication

intermediateResources.title: Made to Stick by Chip & Dan Heath

exercises: Write a one-page executive summary of a complex topic
Give a 5-minute presentation to a friend or family member and ask for feedback
Draft a professional email for three different audiences (technical, executive, customer)
Record yourself explaining a concept and review for clarity

projectIdeas.title: Explainer Blog Series
projectIdeas.description: Write 3 blog posts explaining a technical topic for a non-technical audience

weeklyMilestones: Identify your communication strengths and weaknesses
Deliver a short presentation with visual aids

design.label: Design / Visual Design

intermediateResources.title: Don't Make Me Think by Steve Krug

exercises: Redesign the homepage of a website you use frequently
Create a mood board for a hypothetical product
Design a mobile app screen in Figma with proper spacing and typography
Conduct a quick usability test with a friend on an existing app

projectIdeas.title: App Redesign Case Study
projectIdeas.description: Pick an app with poor UX, research user pain points, and design an improved version with mockups

weeklyMilestones: Learn design principles (contrast, alignment, repetition, proximity)
Create wireframes for a simple app
Build a high-fidelity mockup in Figma
Conduct a usability test and iterate

empathy.label: Empathy

beginnerResources.title: Empathy and Emotional Intelligence at Work
Empathy: Why It Matters by Roman Krznaric

exercises: Conduct 3 empathy interviews (15 min each) with people in different roles
Write a user persona based on a real conversation
Shadow someone in a different job for a day and document pain points
Practice active listening in every conversation for one week

projectIdeas.title: Empathy Map Collection
projectIdeas.description: Create empathy maps for 5 different user types based on interviews

weeklyMilestones: Create a user persona from real data
Apply empathy insights to a design decision

writing.label: Writing

beginnerResources.title: On Writing Well by William Zinsser

exercises: Write a 500-word explanation of a concept you just learned
Edit a piece of writing to reduce word count by 30% without losing meaning
Write the same content for three different audiences
Create a step-by-step tutorial for a task you know well

projectIdeas.title: Technical Blog
projectIdeas.description: Start a blog and publish 4 articles explaining technical concepts clearly

critical-thinking.label: Critical Thinking

beginnerResources.title: Thinking, Fast and Slow by Daniel Kahneman

exercises: Analyze a news article: identify claims, evidence, assumptions, and logical fallacies
Take both sides of a debate and argue each persuasively
Break a complex problem into sub-problems and solve each one
Evaluate 3 competing solutions to a problem using a decision matrix

projectIdeas.title: Decision Framework
projectIdeas.description: Create a reusable decision-making framework and test it on 3 real decisions

weeklyMilestones: Identify cognitive biases in your own thinking
Make a complex decision using a formal method

biology.label: Biology / Life Sciences
exercises: Use NCBI BLAST to compare gene sequences
Analyze a gene expression dataset from GEO
Write a Python script to parse FASTA files
Create a phylogenetic tree from sequence data

projectIdeas.title: Gene Expression Analyzer
projectIdeas.description: Build a tool that visualizes gene expression differences between healthy and disease samples

weeklyMilestones: Interpret results in a biological context

psychology.label: Psychology
exercises: Observe and document 5 cognitive biases in everyday life
Design a behavioral experiment with a clear hypothesis
Analyze a product's UX through a psychological lens
Write a 1-page summary of a psychology research paper

projectIdeas.title: Behavioral Analysis Report
projectIdeas.description: Observe user behavior in a public space, apply psychological frameworks, and present insights

weeklyMilestones: Apply cognitive bias knowledge to real situations

analytical-thinking.label: Analytical Thinking
exercises: Break a business problem into its component parts
Create a root cause analysis for a recent failure
Build a spreadsheet model to compare two business decisions
Present data-driven recommendations to a peer

projectIdeas.title: Market Analysis
projectIdeas.description: Research a market, quantify the opportunity, and present recommendations

weeklyMilestones: Practice breaking complex problems into parts

ethics.label: Ethics / Philosophy

beginnerResources.title: Ethics of AI – University of Helsinki

intermediateResources.title: Weapons of Math Destruction by Cathy O'Neil

exercises: Analyze an AI system for potential bias using an ethical framework
Write a data ethics policy for a hypothetical company
Debate both sides of a technology ethics dilemma
Review a real company's privacy policy and identify concerns

projectIdeas.title: AI Ethics Audit
projectIdeas.description: Select an AI product, audit it for fairness/bias/transparency, and write a recommendations report

weeklyMilestones: Conduct an ethics review of a real product

gis.label: GIS / Mapping
exercises: Create a choropleth map of population density using QGIS
Build an interactive web map with Leaflet.js
Geocode a dataset of addresses and plot them
Analyze spatial data to find optimal locations for a service

projectIdeas.title: Neighborhood Analysis Dashboard
projectIdeas.description: Build an interactive map showing walkability, transit access, and amenities for a city

weeklyMilestones: Create your first map in QGIS
Work with coordinate systems and projections

visualization.label: Data Visualization

beginnerResources.title: Storytelling with Data by Cole Nussbaumer Knaflic

exercises: Recreate a famous data visualization (e.g., Minard's Napoleon march)
Build a dashboard with 3 linked charts in a tool of your choice
Create before/after versions of a poorly designed chart
Design an infographic summarizing a dataset

projectIdeas.title: Interactive Data Story
projectIdeas.description: Create a scrollytelling webpage that reveals insights from a dataset through animated charts

weeklyMilestones: Tell a complete story with data

problem-solving.label: Problem Solving
exercises: Use the 5 Whys technique on a problem you recently faced
Solve 3 logic puzzles from a puzzle book or website
Apply design thinking (empathize, define, ideate, prototype, test) to a real problem
Create a decision tree for a complex choice

projectIdeas.title: Process Improvement Report
projectIdeas.description: Identify an inefficient process, analyze root causes, propose solutions, and measure results

attention-to-detail.label: Attention to Detail
exercises: Review a document and find all formatting inconsistencies
Audit a spreadsheet for formula errors
Create a checklist for a regular process and verify each step
Compare two versions of a document and list all differences

projectIdeas.title: Quality Assurance Checklist
projectIdeas.description: Design a comprehensive QA checklist for a workflow and test it on real work

weeklyMilestones: Apply detail-orientation to a real project

project-management.label: Project Management

intermediateResources.title: The Lean Startup by Eric Ries

exercises: Create a project plan with milestones, tasks, and deadlines for a personal goal
Run a 1-week sprint using a Kanban board
Conduct a retrospective on a completed project
Manage scope creep by prioritizing features using MoSCoW

projectIdeas.title: Event Planner
projectIdeas.description: Plan and execute a small event (meetup, workshop) from start to finish documenting the PM process

weeklyMilestones: Create a project charter and timeline
Set up a task management system

leadership.label: Leadership

intermediateResources.title: Leaders Eat Last by Simon Sinek

exercises: Lead a small group discussion or meeting
Mentor someone junior in a skill you're strong in
Practice giving constructive feedback using the SBI model
Organize and lead a volunteer initiative

projectIdeas.title: Team Project Lead
projectIdeas.description: Lead a small team on a project (hackathon, volunteer work, study group) and document your leadership approach

weeklyMilestones: Reflect on and refine your approach

exercises: Research the fundamentals of this skill area
Find and complete a beginner tutorial
Practice for 30 minutes daily for one week
Apply this skill to a small real-world problem

projectIdeas.title: Skill Portfolio Piece
projectIdeas.description: Create a tangible artifact demonstrating this skill

languages.label: Foreign Languages
exercises: Learn 20 new vocabulary words and practice them in sentences
Have a 10-minute conversation in your target language (even with mistakes)
Watch a TV show in your target language with subtitles and list new words
Write a short journal entry (5-10 sentences) in your target language

projectIdeas.title: Bilingual Content Creator
projectIdeas.description: Create a blog post or video in your target language on a topic you know well

weeklyMilestones: Hold a simple conversation about daily life
Read a simple article and understand the main idea
Write a structured paragraph without a dictionary

cultural-awareness.label: Cultural Awareness

beginnerResources.title: The Culture Map by Erin Meyer

exercises: Research business etiquette in 3 different countries
Interview someone from a different cultural background about their work norms
Analyze a cross-cultural misunderstanding case study
Attend a cultural event or festival outside your own culture

projectIdeas.title: Cross-Cultural Communication Guide
projectIdeas.description: Create a guide for collaborating with teams from 3 different cultural backgrounds

teamwork.label: Teamwork & Collaboration

beginnerResources.title: Google's Project Aristotle – What Makes Teams Effective

exercises: Lead a team retrospective using Start/Stop/Continue format
Practice giving constructive feedback to a colleague
Collaborate on a shared document or project with clear role assignments
Facilitate a decision-making meeting using a structured method

projectIdeas.title: Team Hackathon
projectIdeas.description: Join or organize a hackathon and work with a team to build something in 24-48 hours

weeklyMilestones: Understand team dynamics and your role
Reflect on team performance and improve

creativity.label: Creativity & Innovation

intermediateResources.title: Steal Like an Artist by Austin Kleon

exercises: Generate 20 ideas in 10 minutes for solving a specific problem
Do a SCAMPER exercise on an existing product
Create a mind map connecting 3 unrelated topics
Redesign an everyday object to solve a different problem

projectIdeas.title: Innovation Sprint
projectIdeas.description: Pick a real problem, brainstorm 50+ solutions, prototype the best 3, and test with users

time-management.label: Time Management
exercises: Track how you spend every hour for 3 days
Use the Eisenhower Matrix to prioritize your to-do list
Try the Pomodoro Technique for a full work session
Identify and eliminate your top 3 time wasters

projectIdeas.title: Personal Productivity System
projectIdeas.description: Design and implement a personal productivity system tailored to your work style

weeklyMilestones: Build a daily routine with focused blocks

networking.label: Professional Networking
exercises: Update your LinkedIn profile with a compelling summary
Reach out to 3 people in your target field for informational interviews
Attend a professional meetup or virtual event and introduce yourself to 5 people
Write a follow-up message to someone you met at an event

projectIdeas.title: Industry Research Interviews
projectIdeas.description: Conduct 5 informational interviews with professionals in your target career and summarize insights

organization.label: Organization & Planning

intermediateResources.title: Getting Things Done by David Allen

exercises: Set up a personal knowledge management system (Notion, Obsidian, or similar)
Create a weekly review checklist and do it for 4 weeks
Organize a workspace (physical or digital) using the 5S method
Build a reference filing system for important documents and notes

projectIdeas.title: Life Dashboard
projectIdeas.description: Create a personal dashboard tracking goals, habits, and projects in a tool like Notion

weeklyMilestones: Set up a personal task management system
Create a filing system for notes and documents
